poem:
### Headline Morning

The newspaper folds itself around my coffee
like a dance of ink and shadow.
Names and numbers, Ali Karaki's survival
on a page that will be fish-wrap tomorrow.
In another room, the cat sleeps, unaware
of the tally and the tale. My pen touches 
every black and white world it meets
with something softer, slower, almost 
silent.
